    • search

      @RequestMapping(value="/search", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String search(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request) throws IOException
      Search content by query
      Parameters:
      data - JSON search query
      request - request
      Returns:
      JSON API response
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException A valid JSON search query looks like this:
      { "type": "content_type" "query": "search_query", "args": { "arg1": "arg1", "arg2": "arg2" } } mandatory fields: type, query

    • error

      @RequestMapping("/error") @CrossOrigin public String error(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

    • register

      @RequestMapping(value="/register", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String register(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Register a new user
      Parameters:
      data - JSON user data
      request - request
      Returns:
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "username": "username", "email": "email", "password": "password" }

      Response

      • "email_in_use" if email is already in use
      • "registration_failed" if the registration fails
      • the user id of the newly created account if the registration is successful
      JSON format:
      { "response": "response" }

    • login

      @RequestMapping(value="/login", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String login(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Login
      Parameters:
      data - JSON user data
      request - request
      Returns:
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "email": "email", "password": "password" }
      Response: "0" if login fails, -1 if the user is banned, the user id otherwise { "response": "response" }

    • update

      @RequestMapping(value="/update", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String update(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Update user data
      Parameters:
      data - JSON user data
      request - request
      Returns:
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "id_user": "id", "credential": "credential", "choice": "choice" } choice: 1 - email, 2 - password, 3 - username

    • list

      @RequestMapping(value="/list", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String list(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Get user list
      Parameters:
      data - JSON user data
      request - request
      Returns:
      JSON API response
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "id_user": "id" }
      Response (JSON of content):
      { "content":[ ... { "id_list": "id", "title": "title", "description": "description", "type": "type", "poster": "poster" } ... ] }

    • profile

      @RequestMapping(value="/profile", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String profile(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Get profile data
      Parameters:
      data - JSON user data
      Returns:
      JSON API response
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "id_user": "id" }
      Response (JSON of user data):
      { "id": "id", "email": "email", "username": "username", "completed": "completed", "watching": "watching", "on_hold": "on-hold", "dropped": "dropped", "planning": "planning" }

    • addToList

      @RequestMapping(value="/addToList", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String addToList(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Add content to user list
      Parameters:
      data - JSON user data
      Returns:
      JSON API response
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "id_user": "id", "id_content": "id", "status": "state" "title": "title" "duration": "duration" "n_episode": "n_episode" "link": "link" }
      Response: "1" if successful, "0" otherwise

    • removeFromList

      @RequestMapping(value="/removeFromList", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String removeFromList(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Remove content from user list
      Parameters:
      data - JSON user data
      Returns:
      JSON API response
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "id_user": "id", "id_content": "id" }

      Response

      • "0" if successful
      • "1" if it fails
      { "response": "response" }

    • notifications

      @RequestMapping(value="/notifications", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String notifications(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Get Notifications for a user
      Parameters:
      data - JSON user data
      Returns:
      JSON API response
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "id_user": "id", }
      Response: a JSON of notifications
      { "notifications": [ ... { "id": "id", "title": "title", "description": "description", } ... ] }

    • removeNotification

      @RequestMapping(value="/removeNotification", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String removeNotification(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Removes notification for a user
      Parameters:
      data - JSON user data

    • reviews

      @RequestMapping(value="/reviews", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String reviews(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Get reviews for specified content
      Returns:
      JSON API response
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "id_content": "id", }
      Response: a JSON of reviews
      { "reviews": [ ... { "id": "id", "vote": "vote", "user_comment": "user_comment", "username": "username", "id_user": "id_user", "id_content": "id_content" } ... ]

    • addReview

      @RequestMapping(value="/addReview", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String addReview(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Add review for specified content
      Returns:
      JSON API response
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "vote": "vote", "user_comment": "user_comment", "id_user": "id_user", "id_content": "id_content" "title": "title", "duration": "duration", "n_episode": "n_episode", "link": "link" }

      Response

      • "0" if successful
      • "1" if it fails
      • "2" if the user has already written a review
      { "response": "response" }

    • removeReview

      @RequestMapping(value="/removeReview", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String removeReview(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Remove review for specified content
      Returns:
      JSON API response
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "id_user": "id_user", "id_content": "id_content" }

      Response

      • "0" if successful
      • "1" if it fails
      { "response": "response" }

    • removeUser

      @RequestMapping(value="/removeUser", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String removeUser(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Removes a user
      Parameters:
      data - JSON user data

    • isBanned

      @RequestMapping(value="/isBanned", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String isBanned(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Check if user is banned
      Parameters:
      data - JSON user data
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "id_user": "id_user" }

      Response

      • "0" if the user is not banned
      • "1" if the user is banned
      { "response": "response" }

    • saveIfNotExist

      private static void saveIfNotExist(String id_content, org.json.JSONObject json)
      Check if content exists in database. If it doesn't, add it.
      Parameters:
      id_content -
      json -

    • getMailNotification

      @RequestMapping(value="/getMailNotification", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String getMailNotification(@RequestBody String data, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Check if user opted in for notification by email
      Parameters:
      data - JSON user data
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "id_user": "id_user" }

      Response

      • "0" if the user opted out for notification by email
      • "1" if the user opted in for notification by email
      { "response": "response" }

    • setMailNotification

      @RequestMapping(value="/setMailNotification", method=POST, consumes="text/plain") @CrossOrigin public String setMailNotification(@RequestBody String id_user, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Set user preference to receive notification by email
      Parameters:
      id_user -
      A valid JSON request looks like this:
      { "id_user": "id_user" }

      Response

      Request is successfully processed if response is "1" { "response": "response" }
